Text:
More important than ever? Sure it is. This is the very best that the creationist crowd has been able to produce. Its author was exposed during the Dover trial as an individual whose conception of science encompasses things like astrology. To top it off, the "irreducible complexity" arguments presented in the book have all been thoroughly dismissed in the context of evolution by natural selection. 

It is indeed more important than ever in that it patently reveals what a pathetic bunch of cave dwellers the creationist crowd are.

This is a great book. To bitter sistromo: none of the irreducible complexity arguments were refuted. Please take some time to review them (if you really care) - they contain very little of logic. (Macro) evolution by natural selection is not scientific,  because it cannot be observer nor repeated. 

Thanks for the upload.

Intellectual Design is definitely not scientific, because it cannot be observer nor repeated. There is plenty of instances where evolution was observed, and it can be repeated -- artificial selection.
